body.p: IAS 34 Interim Financial Reporting (paragraph 29) states that the same recognition principles should be applied in the annual financial statements and in the interim financial report. By applying the requirements of IAS 34 (paragraphs 31–32 and 39, as illustrated by paragraphs B2, B4 and B11 of the Illustrative Examples accompanying IAS 34), no liability would be recognised at the end of an interim reporting period if the obligating event has not yet occurred. For example, an entity does not have an obligation at the end of an interim reporting period if the present obligation arises only at the end of the annual reporting period. Similarly, if a present obligation to pay a levy exists at the end of an interim reporting period, the liability should be recognised.
